result.name: care-to-learn-learner-attendance-and-childcare-provider-attendance-monitoring
result.notes: For the Care to Learn Student Support Scheme monthly attendance monitoring is undertaken to ensure the young parent and their child remain in education and childcare (respectively).  This data is collected from the education institution the young parent is enrolled with and the Childcare Provider that is caring for their child. This data is collected to determine whether or not support payments for that individual student should continue.  It is mandatory; failure to provide the data will result in payments being stopped.

organization.name: education-funding-agency
organization.title: Education and Skills Funding Agency
organization.description:
The ESFA brings together the former responsibilities of the Education Funding Agency (EFA) and Skills Funding Agency (SFA) to create a single agency accountable for funding education and skills for children, young people and adults.

ESFA is an executive agency, sponsored by the Department for Education.

result.title: Care to Learn, Learner Attendance and Childcare Provider Attendance Monitoring

extras.value: This data is not published because it contains personal data belonging to young parents, including details about their child. To publish this data would be a breach of data protection laws
